Package client.graphics

Class GameNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.application.Application
      • client.graphics.GameNode
  • public class GameNode
extends javafx.application.Application
    This class starts and displays the window, where the game and the chat interactions take place.

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        Starts methods needed for the display of the whole window.
        Parameters:

      • start

        public void start​(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)
        This method defines the window properties and content and displays them.
        Specified by:
        start in class javafx.application.Application

      • movePlayerEntity

        public static void movePlayerEntity​(RenderedTile oldTile,
                                    RenderedTile newTile,
                                    PlayerEntity player)
        Updates the location of the rendered car of the player independent of the game state.

        By providing an old and a new tile as positions, the rendered car will be translated to said new position. Also plays back an audio file of a car engine.

        Parameters:
        oldTile - describes the position of the rendered car before a move
        newTile - describes the position of the rendered car after a move
        player - describes the "owner" of the car that is moved

      • getTileIndexOfCoordinate

        public static int getTileIndexOfCoordinate​(int x,
                                           int y)
        Tiles are stored in a one-dimensional array, this method is used to provide the index of a requested tile by using the corresponding x and y coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x - the horizontal coordinate of the tile in relation to the upper left corner (increases rightward).
        y - the vertical coordinate of the tile in relation to the upper left corner (increases downward).
        Returns:
        the index of the stored tile in the list of all tiles.

      • drawPossibleMoves

        public static void drawPossibleMoves​(java.util.List<Location> moves,
                                     Location nextVectorArrivalPoint)
        Displays the legal moves of a player provided in a list.

        By providing a point and a next vector, the method draws circles of all neighboring tiles of the arrival point of the new vector. Depending on whether the tile is a legal move the circle will be either green or red.

        If no legal move is possible, the player will be notified by a text animation.

        Parameters:
        moves - list of legal and clickable tiles for a player.
        nextVectorArrivalPoint - the coordinates of the next vector.

      • receiveMessage

        public static void receiveMessage​(java.lang.String message)
        Displays incoming messages onto the TextArea. Plays a pop sound upon display.
        Parameters:
        message - content of the incoming message.

      • drawInitialPossibleMoves

        public static void drawInitialPossibleMoves​(PlayerEntity entity)
        Displays possible moves in the first turn of a player. Necessary, because the usual drawPossibleMoves is only called after a move has been made. This is not the case at the beginning of a game.
        Parameters:
        entity - player whose initial possible moves will be displayed.

      • removeCircles

        public static void removeCircles()
        Graphically removes all drawn circles. For some reason required to iterate over all children 4 times in order to achieve this.

      • resetClickableTiles

        public static void resetClickableTiles()
        Sets all tiles to non-legal moves. Required to calculate next legal moves.

      • createContent

        private javafx.scene.Parent createContent()
        This method effectively creates the content.

        First it sets the size of the world. Afterwards it defines the elements and functions needed for things such as the music and the chat. What follows next is the arrangement of the individual elements created before. In addition the textures are called and rendered and the position of the player is constantly being kept updated and eventually the world with all its content is being returned.

        Returns:
        the pane, that contains all Nodes necessary for the game.

      • initializeGame

        public static void initializeGame​(java.lang.String[] players)
        Draws sprite entities for all players in the lobby, thus starting the game. The position of each sprite is determined by the index of the player in the lobby-internal list of players. After that, the local player will be bound to one of the drawn sprite entities - his/her controlled car.
        Parameters:
        players - array of names of the lobby members. Required for generating entity sprites.

      • clearField

        public static void clearField()
        This resets the playingfield.

      • updateNode

        public static void updateNode​(java.lang.String[] moveInfo)
        This method updates the position of entities and recalculates legal moves for the local player.
        Parameters:
        moveInfo - contains information about the player who made a move and his/her new location.

      • practiceStart

        public static void practiceStart()
        Starts practice mode with a single car.

      • practiceStop

        public static void practiceStop()
        Stops practice mode by clearing the screen.

      • createChat

        private javafx.scene.layout.Pane createChat()
        This method creates a BorderPane layout that is needed for the menu and chat.
        Returns:
        returns a child containing chat and menubar.
